DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vaginal Internal Radiation Therapy Intracavitary Route of Administration Top Location Total Dose Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the vagina._A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor._Administration of a drug within any natural, non-pathologic cavity, such as that of cervix, uterus, or penis._The uppermost part, side, or surface of something._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the vagina or to any sheath.:(ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the vagina.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

Property.preferredName: Intracavitary Route of Administration Top Location Total Dose Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Administration of a drug within any natural, non-pathologic cavity, such as that of cervix, uterus, or penis.:The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug within any natural, non-pathologic cavity, such as that of cervix, uterus, or penis.
The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
